Reviews.Title: “My Stay”
Reviews.Author: nllyons
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in the hotel recently. The staff are very welcoming and the bedrooms are clean and well equipped. The position is excellent being so close to Kings Cross Station and therefore all the major London sites. In particular the square that the hotel is situated in is very quiet and a superb amenity especially for the summer months when I hope to come again

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for location and price”
Reviews.Author: bandearg
Reviews.Content: Straight across the road from Kings cross/st pancras station and about a 5 minute walk to Euston. The hotel has been newly done up and is perfect, the rooms are tiny but big enough for the amount of time you will be staying in them, I would definately stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Be warned!”
Reviews.Author: Numberw0man
Reviews.Content: The hotel website states that parking is free on the weekend. Since we were arriving by car on a Friday night, I emailed the hotel to ask about parking that night. The response was that it was free after 6.30pm til 8.30am on Saturday morning, which translated to me, as being free from Friday 6.30pm and then all through the weekend as stated on their website. However,we found that there are restrictions on Saturday from 8.30am till 1.30pm and it is parking for residents only. This means if you had intended to go out Saturday and leave the car parked, it's impossible to do so. You either have to find a pay car park from 8.30am till 1.30pm (and then who is going to interrupt their day out sightseeing to come back and move the car back to the free parking outside the hotel?) or end up paying for many more hours while you leave the car in the pay car park, while you are out for the rest of the day and possibly into the night. This small but INCORRECT piece of advice from the hotel, was of great concern to us, since we had specifically chosen this hotel for the free all weekend parking we thought they were offering, and which was implied on their website. Anything else I would say about the hotel, pales into insignificance, in comparison to this great inconvenience.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: sarahNorwich86
Reviews.Content: A lovely hotel for a reasonable rate. The room was large and comfortable, clean and nicely decorated. A little bit noisy when other guests arrived back late but can't really complain. An adequate breakfast and friendly staff, although a small room. You do have to check in at the reception for a partner hotel, but it is only across the road, so not really a big problem. Around a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “A place to put your head”
Reviews.Author: Buster1980
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in very close proximity to St Pancras International train station and Kings Cross and is therefore well situated. It is worth noting that the reception for the hotel is situated across the road at the Melville and as such there is no one on the door at Albion which wasn't really a problem for me but it is a little isolated at night and as a single female I didn't always feel completely safe as there were people just hanging around the area when I returned at night. The front door is keyed, as is your own room so I guess its ok but I didn't feel that safe. Single room was tiny but that is London and you get what you pay for. The room came with one bath towel (no bath mat / hand towel) and a bar of soap and towels wont be changed daily. The room was clean enough although the red doona cover was fility, I dont think it gets changed for each guest. Wifi worked well. I didnt try breakfast. On the upside, staff were helpful and it satisfied my needs but it is literally somewhere to put your head.

Reviews.Title: “"Low Budget" Stay”
Reviews.Author: Evi788
Reviews.Content: Strong Points: Very friendly, polite & helpful personnel, very convenient to King's Cross Underground Station, location, decently clean, reasonably priced Weak points: terribly small rooms, WC/bathroom, no lift (due to the type of building untouched by time & technical evolution), minimum facilities, non-existing "free" Wi-fi.

Reviews.Title: “'Cramped'”
Reviews.Author: ChrisWMorpethUK
Reviews.Content: I booked a 'family room' for a 2 night stay. The room was to cater for 2 adults and our teenage daughter. 'Cramped' best describes our experience. The room was not really fit for purpose. A double bed and a single jammed into corners and approx 5 sq feet of floor space. The stifling en suite shower room was tiny and (in theory at least) of wet room design; except it wasn't really a wet room resulting in both the en suite AND bedroom floors becoming saturated after shower use and (as other subscribers have mentioned) no floor towel provided. Furthermore, the ill fitting shower door had no lock or door handle! The room was situated right next to the front door and directly above the dining room so we found it quite noisy too. On the first morning we attempted breakfast but there were no tables available so swerved it completely. Every hotel has a place in the accommodation 'food chain'. At Â£135 per night, The Albion House Hotel is pitching with those hotels at the lower end of large established hotel chain territory but is nowhere near that standard of accommodation. In my opinion it is delivering accommodation in Â£50-Â£75 per night territory and as such is rotten value for money. I won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money!”
Reviews.Author: pradomalo
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here several times for business and i can assure that is a very comfortable accomodation for what it cost. Rooms are New, beds are very comfortable and the area is calm and close to' St. Pancras station by One min walking. Staff is very helpful and Patrick The owner, known as Briatore, is a great guy who always suggest me nice places where to eat!

Reviews.Title: “Poor”
Reviews.Author: Raisingirl81
Reviews.Content: I was looking forward to spend a few nights in London with my partner. She arrived a little earlier and was put into a basement room with a tiny window because no other room was available, or so they said. Also we booked the Albion House Hotel but were given a room at the Excelsior instead. The next day, the concierge promised, we'd be able to move into a better room. We asked for a room at the Albion but none was available. I was puzzled but decided not to say anything since I was tired and just wanted a nice room. We were then put into Melville Hotel. The first impression of the room was actually good, it looked clean and was modernly furnitured. However it lacked diverse basic equipment like tissues, a bin (we used a bag which was taken away by the cleaning staff with the result of having nothing), face and floor towels, a blowdryer, bedside table... Also we were told that there was Wi-Fi, but couldn't get a signal. However we were still relieved about the improvement. We weren't pleased about the breakfast however. It was without question the most horrific breakfast I ever had at a hotel. First of all we had to wait in a cue cause there was only room for approximately 10 people. The "buffet" consisted of toast, cheap cheese and ham slices, cold boiled eggs (if one was lucky) and fruit juice. And there was some jam and Nutella on the table. I'm sure most of the lodgers decided to stay away from breakfast after their first morning. At least so did we. Now some people could argue that that's what it's like in a budget hotel but 100 Pounds a night are not actually cheap and one could expect a moderate service. Actually the only good thing about this hotel is the shower and its great location.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel that really suits my needs”
Reviews.Author: ryan_leach
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel on numerous occasions over the last couple of years. The staff are very accomadating, particularly as they are flexible about when I book in and out - as I generally work nights on business. All the rooms that i have stayed in are newly refurbished and to a high standard. the best thing of all is that although my company would pay for the nearby Premier Inn or travelodge ( at double the price! ) I rather stay in the much quieter hotel, with no industrial sized aircon units that keep me awake! Best budget hotel I have used in London by far, and I have stayed in a few!

Reviews.Title: “We won't be back!”
Reviews.Author: Rosemary040
Reviews.Content: Smallest room ever. Very basic facilities. Not even tissues in the room, let alone handtowel or bathmat. Very basic shower! Very noisy with other occupants. Breakfast very basic and poorly organised, servicing three hotels in too small a space! Not happy having reception at another hotel, not told until arrival at 11pm this was the case! Unfriendly at reception. Glad it was a one night stay only!

Reviews.Title: “ugh...don't do it!”
Reviews.Author: agentlori
Reviews.Content: This place was clean, but crowded both in the bedrooms and horribly crowded in the Continental Breakfast. WARNING...check in is at the Melville Hotel in the same square. Just not worth the money we spent when compared to the other three hotels we stayed in on this trip. Avoid it...want something lovely? Stay out of town at One Six Two in Greenwich, London!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible!!”
Reviews.Author: BeniLovers
Reviews.Content: Please avoid this hotel its nothing like the web page pictures show. The rooms are dirty and run down. We did not risk going for breakfast as I need to be careful what I eat, so can't comment. Best advice is stay away from this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is good for a business trip stay.”
Reviews.Author: TessaD20
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because of the price and the reviewson here were ok. Booked it through Late Rooms and got it for Â£82.50 per night for a twin room. You do need to check in at the Melville Hotel round the corner but fortunately I was aware of this after reading the reviews here otherwise I might have been a bit put out by this! The room was small but clean. It had a tv and free wifi access. This was all I needed! The bathroom was also small but fine. I didn't experience the service so can't comment on that. The location is good, just a few minutes walk from King's Cross Station. The only thing is that on the first night, there were some people in the park making a bit of noise which was kind of annoying. The second night was fine though, so I may have just been unlucky. Overall, I'd stay there again. For a business trip, it's fine.

Reviews.Title: “DISCUSTING!”
Reviews.Author: xLYNDSAYx
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night. By looking on the internet before we booked the hotel looked really nice. Cleanliness is really important to us as my husband is very ill. It looked very clean and tidy on the photos.Only one room was ready when we arrived. When we got to the rooms they were dirty. We turned on the ceiling fan in our friends room and we were choked by the amount of dust that came off it. The bathroom was so small you could hardly turn round in it. And the room my husband and i stayed in was down in the basement as they were fully booked even though we booked in 7 weeks in advance! and the room stunk of fags! ala though the rooms were non smoking. I would not ever stay here again. Breakfast was so vile. The boiled eggs were black in the middle!!! and there was no choice of food. the beans were cold and the cutlery was dirty. Do your selves a favour and dont stay here. I am not stuck up my own bum atall. i just like some where clean to stay esspecially for Â£100 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Patrick is the best hotel concierge ever and his hotel is wonderful!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: smetviner
Reviews.Content: Patrick was available to help us during the strike!He was concerned for our plane reservation and helped us book a room near Heathrow Airport! I highly recommend his bed and breakfast hotels for their price and cleanliness!

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms for an excellent price, My friends and I we're impressed!!”
Reviews.Author: MichaelFraser
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a few of my friends and it was perfect for our needs, nice rooms excellent location and easy to get anywhere in the country never mind just London from this location. It has everything you need in walking distance, Pubs, Tube, Banks, Shops, Currency Exchange and fast food resturants for when you need some quick food in the morning. Few minutes tube to centre of the city and an excellent hotel in all. Made to feel very welcome by Friendly staff. Just a nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good Balance between budget and style”
Reviews.Author: nikkibarbourella
Reviews.Content: Good hotel and excellent location next to Kings Cross Station. Stayed for a business trip in London. Room was clean, bed was firm and sheets were clean. Breakfast sufficient and staff friendly. Room had wifi, big flat screen TV and en suite bathroom. I booked throught the hotels website and got the room for Â£77 for the night . Excellent value . I was really happy that the hotel had hair straighteners as i left mine at home ...Disaster avoided ! Meeting succesful. All in a ll a positive expreience . Hassle free !Will reccomend to colleagues and friends and will return soon.

Reviews.Title: “well located, but not satisfactory”
Reviews.Author: EricAshley47
Reviews.Content: We stayed overnight before leaving on Eurostar. We'd booked, and paid for, a twin room on line. But when we checked in as instructed at their sister hotel, we were told that the room had not been vacated, and we were offered two singles three floors apart. We accepted, since an argument would have got a refund at best, leaving us to find an alternative. Otherwise, clean, nicely decorated, handy for the station. Breakfast included, but very basic.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT BOOK HERE or with the Melville Hotel Group!”
Reviews.Author: Merynne
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on the pictures on the website, the star rating and the inclusions. I thought that I had booked a lovely, refurbished hotel room with an ensuite, however, when I went to book in to the Albion House Hotel (at the Melville Hotel Reception) I was told that all of the rooms were taken and I was bumped to the Excelsior Hotel which was a few doors away. I checked this against the Hotels group register and my booking was not at the Albion House Hotel although I had booked directly through the website. When I inspected the new room, it was a below ground with no security on the windows and was musty. The ensuite was joined to the room, but was through a 10 metre corridor from the bed. It was only after an hour of arguing with the reception clerk (who could not get in touch with his manager) that I was given another refurbished ensuite room in the Melville Hotel at a discounted rate. Next time I travel to the UK I will be booking through the larger, well-known hotel groups.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for a visit to London”
Reviews.Author: NZGill
Reviews.Content: We spent 10 days at Albion House Hotel (actually we were staying in the Excelsior, which is one of several houses on Argyle Square owned by Albion House.) Our room was quite small, but adequate once you got used to it. Good TV with a wide choice of channels, and free WiFi, although it wasn't very strong. The bathroom was small but adequate, and the towels were changed daily. We had a room at the back which was quiet, but the Square itself is a quiet location so I don't think noise would be a problem anywhere in the hotel. We had breakfast in the dining room in the basement of the Albion. The food was pretty good if a bit monotonous, and the staff were friendly and professional. The dining room is pretty small so if the hotel is full it's a good idea to go to breakfast early, otherwise you might have to wait for a seat. The main plus for this hotel is that it's two minutes' walk from Kings Cross Station, so it's well placed for getting to and from Heathrow or taking the tube. A lot of buses also go past Kings Cross, so if you want to take a double decker around London (recommended - get an Oyster card) you are in a great location. Some good Italian and Indian restaurants nearby, also a laundromat, and at Brunswick shopping centre there's a cinema playing foreign films and a couple of good restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money; helpful people”
Reviews.Author: James5353
Reviews.Content: On arrival I found the staff friendly and helpful in every respect. My single room in the Excelsior (just a few paces from the Albion) may have been small but had everything I needed, including welcome tea & coffee facilities. The bed was comfortable and I slept very well indeed. The hotel is in a peaceful square without noise and disruption late at night or in early morning. It's extremely well situated for King's Cross and St. Pancras railway stations. Added to this I considered it good value for money and would happily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice rooms, very clean... good value for money”
Reviews.Author: pradomalo
Reviews.Content: I've been there many times. I have always booked through the hotel website, it is more convenient... Under my point of view, do not expect to find something better in London for 80 pounds! Everybody knows that in England a hotel that is 4 stars in south Europe is 3 stars, I mean that the quality, size, services is not so good compared with the rest of countries.... and you pay more! So , in the Albion I've found always a good value for money, it is a reasonable prize for a compact room. Everything is clean, there is no moquette, the rooms are new (very comfortable bed)... maybe you'll find the bathroom quite little, but it is normal... you'll have the same problem everywhere. I highly recommend everybody to stay in this budget hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location”
Reviews.Author: maggietoot
Reviews.Content: 10 mins walk from Euston station and 2 mins from Kings Cross station. 10 mins on bus to London theatre land. Ideal for 1 or 2 night stay, room small but comfortable and very clean. Plenty of pubs and eateries in the vicinity. We like to go to London to the theatre and we will have no hesitation in staying in this hotel again and we would recommend this hotel to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Compact, clean and very friendly”
Reviews.Author: Suerou
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at Albion House, this is the second time we have been. The room was small, however it had everything we could want, and was very clean. It is in a very quiet and convenient area near Kings Cross station. The staff are friendly and we would certainly go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent business or personal travellers hotel”
Reviews.Author: TLNB
Reviews.Content: The Albion is wonderfully clean and the rooms are all brightly decorated and modern with very clean en suite facilities. The staff are very friendly and accommodating and the locaton is ideal for getting around al areas of London. It really is excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great quality for a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: XtraIT
Reviews.Content: I have been staying in the hotel regularly as of May 2009. All I can say is - great quality for reasonable price, polite and helpful staff and superb location. My colleagues from our office in abroad are also always staying in Albion House Hotel when in London. The location is absolutely great - centrally based, not far away from main attractions. Great transport links as well. Would definitely recommend this hotel to people, who expect great service in a cosy hotel for a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Close and Comfort! Value for money!”
Reviews.Author: SpursSarpsborg
Reviews.Content: Close to Kings Cross (tube/bus/rail), friendly staff, the rooms are clean, OK breakfast, very good location, comfortable beds! Perfect stay for those who don't need a big lobby, mini bar etc Very close to all lines in London Underground. Nice park area. Central located, but quiet area.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased”
Reviews.Author: dean37
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my wife and our young son we had a triple room which was a nice size and accomadated our needs very well, ground floor so was easy access esp with a small child and luggage, tv,towels,tea coffee facillites all supplied too, frindly staff and a great location for a short family break

Reviews.Title: “Happy”
Reviews.Author: lisaoneillw
Reviews.Content: I stayed here at the Albion House Hotel for 3 Nights for business I am was very happy with my stay, nice sized room clean and tidy and all the pieces I needed ie tea coffee, towels hairdyer, also TV with free view which was great, also was able to work from my room in the evenings as there is free wi-fi connection which was even better would be very happy to stay again either for business or personal

Reviews.Title: “A top stay in a top place in a top town!”
Reviews.Author: appletony7
Reviews.Content: The Albion House is the perfect place to stay for a trip to London. It's 30 seconds walk from Kings Cross/St. Pancras and only 5 minutes from Euston station. Central London is all on your doorstep. We didn't need to take a taxi all weekend!

Reviews.Title: “Shabby but not chic!”
Reviews.Author: WizzleTheDiva
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Albion House Hotel for 1 night in July. We were a group of 3 female friends, we had booked a triple room several months in advance, and followed it up since then with several phone calls - including one on the day of arrival - to check the booking was still OK. Arrived at the end of an evening out to check in as arranged, and were given 1 "double" and 1 single room by a very rude night receptionist, meaning (a) we were separated (something we'd gone to great lengths to avoid as it was a kind of reunion night out) and (b) 2 of us had to share a very small double bed. Rooms were at the top of the house and very hot, bathrooms grubby, and the towels were a joke. My bath towel was a small, ancient, well worn towel absolutely full of holes! Needless to say we did not stay for breakfast in the morning. Put our complaints to the person on duty in the morning who pleaded ignorance and said we'd have to email the manager, who has not responded to any of these issues. Avoid!

Reviews.Title: “That was not a room, it was a closet!”
Reviews.Author: Jiariel
Reviews.Content: Before we traveled I read some of the reviews, and took my chances, and it was all they said and more! The check-in was in diferent hotel, when we arrived a no talking man, made us pay first, and only after it, he gave us a room key for the Excelsior Hotel, not for the Albion House. Our room was on the ground floor, and it was so small, that i canÂ´t really descrive! I can only say that before I get out the bathroom i have to knock on the door and my boyfriend needed to get up on the bed, so I can get out! The breakfast was in Albion, so we needed to go outside, and it was only tea, coffee and toast. It was not a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as we thought”
Reviews.Author: lue_21_uk
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews on here we were very apprehensive about what we found here even had a look elsewhere but for the price and location we couldnt find anything. Location was great for St Pancreas and Kings Cross. We had to check in a the Melville which was accross the square this one didnt look as nice, we nearly we seperated as we had three rooms but we all got in the Albion. The Albion hotel was clean tidy , suprising how what you can get in such a small space ie bathroom shower, toilet and some have a sink in the bathroom the size of a wardrobe. Bu the overall thing that let this place down would be the breakfast which was included but might aswell not have been as it was a joke, choice of 2 cereals, chesse slice, hard boiled egg and white toast!!! So overall somewhere to put your head down alright.

Reviews.Title: “Dont go here”
Reviews.Author: Headmoss
Reviews.Content: Have to check in at a different hotel down the road which is no problem and the woman was helpful. Rooms were ok......and thats the best bit!! Beds were uncomfortable but at least clean. Carpets were worn and dirty, kettle did not work, towels were old and frayed. I did not expect too much before my visit but did expect cleanliness. Service was non existent. Had to wait 15 mins to get a seat for Breakfast (room holds about 10 people). Then had to wait another 10 mins for our dirty table to be cleaned and new cutlery etc. Went to get some cereal but there was none left! (This was 8.45 in the morning and Breakfast only opens at 8). When I asked for some the lady did not understand me as she did not speak much English!! Eventually got some toast after another 10 mins but there was nothing to put on it! I asked the lady for some butter and jam. She came back with 2 satchets of Strawberry jam but not butter. I went back to her and asked for some butter or marg but they had none!! So, the choice for Breakfast was cereal, which they had none or toast, which they had no spread. Walked out and packed and then went back to other hotel to check out and complain. I asked for my money for Breakfast back and explained the reason. How bizarre, the lady that had checked us in the previous day had lost the ability to converse in English and kept saying she did not understand!! By this time I had given up and just left.......never to return!!

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money in the heart of London”
Reviews.Author: KPH111
Reviews.Content: Clean and friendlly, spotless room (recently refurbished), ideal location close to St Pancras and Kings Cross, beside UCL. Check in in Melville Hotel, room in Imperial, brekfeast in Albion House, who cares, at the rates we paid this was excelllent value. Friendly receptionist, good brekfeast, all buildings within thirty paces of each other. Held our cases until 7pm on departure date.

Reviews.Title: “Good place , good location...nice people !”
Reviews.Author: AbbsShh
Reviews.Content: I stay in London B&Bs quite often due to work comitments , which means i need a place : clean and conmfortable room for 3 nights per week. I only discovered the Albion a few months ago , and have been staying there ever since. A colleague told me about it and i decided to take his advise .....I ve stayed in a few places in the area , and the Albion seems to be the best by some distance. The rooms are a good enough size but more importantly they are clean and bright and excellent value for money in Central London. Â£60 per night for a single room is pretty good. The staff are always helpful and look after when im there. I do recomend this place to business travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Dont think about going there.”
Reviews.Author: samandlewis
Reviews.Content: We had two family rooms ,one was on the fourth floor and the other was in the basement.You have to climb narrow stairs so its difficult if you have any large luggage.Both rooms had a bad smell,and the shower room was so small the wash basin had to be located in the bedroom.The Continental Breakfast was the worst hotel breakfast that we have ever had. None of the staff were very good with speaking English.The only good thing is that the room had been decorated but it did not stop the bad smell.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Rocky_Bahdur
Reviews.Content: Great service and very cosy rooms at a great price Parth Parmar, Leicestershire

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: courtmonster
Reviews.Content: The staff was very accommodating. We had to arrive a day early and they were very nice and helpful. The hotel was clean and the breakfast was great. I would highly recommend this hotel to travelers!

Reviews.Title: “Lack of Security and Surveilance”
Reviews.Author: Zjheol
Reviews.Content: My mother, my sister and I stayed in the Albion Hotel during the last two weeks in December. Upon Arrival we were told that a laptop computer had been stolen from a room and that a report had been filed with police. When we arrived a few hours later there was a posted reward for anyone who had information regarding the theft. The next two nights we stayed were uninterrupted, and we assumed that things had quieted down.We left the hotel one evening and arrived several hours later. When we returned we quickly noticed that things had been rifled through. Our suitcases were searched to the bottoms. A digital camera was stolen, along with two cellphones. 80$ were stolen as well as all three passports, two ID'S and a driver's license. We first reported to the receptionist, then the police. The receptionist informed us that the surveillance camera in front of the hotel was inoperable, and had been prior to the first robberies. Conveniently, the hard drive containing the video had become corrupted as well. Anyway, I am just freely expressing my experience. Aside from this unfortunate event, the hotel is very comfortable and hospitable for the value of a London Hotel. I don't discourage staying there in any way. Cheers.

Reviews.Title: “Surprised”
Reviews.Author: Jetlaggedtothemax
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on this site, I thought I'd take my chances.It rated better than others in this price range.I was expecting the worse! However I was quite surprised. Yes you do have to check in at the mentone across the road but that is only 30 steps away.The neighbourhood is quiet and non threatening-I walked through it morning noon and night.The room although very small, was clean and had the amenities I required. Breakfast was sufficient coffee, tea and toast.The staff were friendly and accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “Disgisting!!DISGRACEFUL and inhabitable!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: louiseoc
Reviews.Content: 8 of us(girls ) arrived at albion house hotel on a fri night at 1am after a flight and transfers to kingcross. We had to go across to the Melville hotel reception to check in. On arrival we were told they knew nothing about us(despite us having a printed confirmation and number and having paid a deposit).We were(after a considerable about of argueing with the man on the desk) brought to the carlton hotel around the corner. We were shown two rooms for 4 people per room. this hotel was grotty and two people per bed in a small queen size bed. the shower and toilet were beside each other in a tiny bathroom. the following morning we went to the melville reception where we were promised that they had rooms for us that night. We returned later that day after heading into london and were told that we there were no rooms for us, even though we were promised earlier that morning that there were. The manager was rude, obnocious and very very unhelpful but eventally showed us to a further two more hotels where our party had to seperate. The part hotel was one of thes. This was a disgrace! one of the rooms had lights hanging off the ceiling held in place with tissue paper, ripped wallpaper, a curtain hanging sideways by a thread and RAT bait in numerous areas on the floor. THe floor was filthy and the bed was broken in two areas when you sat on it. The bathroom was tiny and unclean!this was inhabitable and a helath and safety hazard!!! We were not contacted earlier in the day by the manager to inform us of this move, we could have had a chance to find somewhere else.The manager was so unhelpful and very nasty!!! In fact, a family with two small children arrived in the same situation and were left with no where to stay, obviously causing huge distress! We were only looking for somwhere to stay that was basic and clean, we weren't fussy travellors and this was neither. NEVER EVER STAY HERE!!!!avoid anywhere on arglyle square/street. It's an absolute disgrace and totally unaccepatable. It's a big SCAM!!!!!!STEER CLEAR!!!!Inhabitable and Disgusting to sum it up!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “terrible...bad, bad service”
Reviews.Author: DublinSara
Reviews.Content: We didn't actually mangae to stay in this hotel...seeing as the manager denied any knowledge of us despite the fact we had an email with confirmation number. The manager was really unhelpful..he 'helpfully' managed to find accomodation in a hotel down the road (the Park Hotel), in which we found our bed was broke, the bathroom light didn't work, the heat was 'stuck' on, the light hanging out of the ceiling, ceiling holes stuffed with toilet paper and worst of all actual RAT bait in the bedroom under the sink...disgusting. worst hotel i've ever stayed in...steer clear.

Reviews.Title: “Dishonest, total unacceptable”
Reviews.Author: daudau
Reviews.Content: Very dishonest and totally unacceptable! I booked Albion House but all guests who book Albion House have to check-in at Melville Hotel which is 1 minute walk. I booked a twin en-suite room for two nights at Albion House and the guy at the reception of Melville Hotel asked me to pay all my room charge first, which I did. Then he showed me to Albion House. On the way, he told me that tomorrow I have to move to another room. He said he has given me a bigger room. The way he said that as if he has done a big favour for me! I stayed two nights only but have to change room every night. I felt this hotel very dishonest. I made reservation in July, if you cannot accommodate my request for a room for two nights, you can reject my booking but they confirmed my booking. I felt they are dishonest because the guy at reception never mentioned to me that I have to change room before I paid my room charge. If I knew that, there were >40 hotels in that district, I maybe able to find another hotel. It was so troublesome as I have to pack and unpack. Besides, no bath soap and shampoo provided in the room, only a tiny piece of soap. The alarm in the room is not working. Breakfast is very simple, they give you 2 slices of white bread. On the counter, there is boiled egg, two kinds of cereal, orange juice or apple juice, some canned fruit, coffee or tea. I strongly suggest you do not stay in this hotel or other hotel under this group which is Excelsior Hotel and Melville Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “loved it...absolutely loved it”
Reviews.Author: tracy28
Reviews.Content: Albion House Hotel is a great hotel...great value and offer!! Good location and environment...far from traffic so you can have a quiet night.. Not too far from the most happenings in London Great service providing 247 reception..excellent choice of breakfast... Rooms are well maintained and necessities are provided Great staff, very accomodating!! Good for family/friends/couples/ I recommend this hotel to anyone who is visiting London...

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay - Great Value!!”
Reviews.Author: smokey1111
Reviews.Content: As a regular business traveller to London, I always find that the Albion delivers great value and comfort. The service is great, the staff are friendly and the rooms are clean. It's such a great place to stay that I always book here when in London.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel for Central London”
Reviews.Author: BDO1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this Central London hotel for 4 nights and I can recommend it to anyone without hesitation. I am somewhat confused about some of the negative reviews on here because for the low price you pay, this place is centrally located, extremely clean, friendly, and we found that they will bend over backwards to give any advice on what to do/where to go in London. The rooms are airy and light and CLEAN, with modern but simple decor. An absolute bargain, and far exceeding anything we were expecting for this price-range. The only other comparable hotels I have found in Central London were about twice the price! If you are looking for an affordable, clean, centrally located hotel with friendly service look no further!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean Simple Unspectacular”
Reviews.Author: GillsMan7
Reviews.Content: First of all, bear in mind that in London hotels can cost a lot. I booked a twin room at this place for Â£75. I checked in across the road and the receptionist was very friendly. The room wasn't huge, but it was clean. The bathroom was miniscule and not fancy in any way shape or form. It served its purpose however and I was able to shower without feeling totally grossed out. There was a TV in the room which was a bonus. This place is located yards away from Kings Cross station which is convenient. I used it as a place to change and sleep before and after a party nearby in London. This is perhaps its best purpose: a stopover or a place to rest your head. Breakfast was simple: a couple of rounds of toast and some tea. It's a shame: I quite fancied a fry-up! Overall, I'd recommend it to people who need a place to crash out, but not to people who want anything fancy or a hotel with amenities. This is about as simple as it gets.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Make A Booking At This Hotel - Terrible”
Reviews.Author: Lochster
Reviews.Content: I booked directly on-line with The Albion House Hotel on 30th October 2006 for a stay of 1 night on 25th November 2006 On arrival I proceeded to check in at The Melville Hotel, 39 Argyle Square, which is a down market in need of a good clean sister hotel. Having waited 10 mins to check in, I was ushered to the room where the receptionist/owner? proceeded to inform me that they had just had a major water leak and the room that I was to stay in was flooded and she only had 1 room available within the Melville Hotel, this is on a Saturday afternoon at 3.30pm and she did not have the courtesy to call me (But I am sure they would have charghed had i not turned up. (Likely story - probably sold my room for higher rate) I proceeded to look at the double en-suite room at the Melville Hotel and everything you have read about this hotel is true. The room was the about 7ft *4ft, the curtains hanging from the window and it was four flights up a narrow staircase with no means of exit should there have been a fire. I would not have let a down and out stay there. Strangley the whole of London was fully booked and the receptionist/owner was rather uncaring that we had no where to stay. Well ended up in Croydon @ Jury's for Â£59.99 which was a palatial kingdom compared to the Albion House/Melville Hotel. So if you want a guaranteed room for the night and don't want a frantic search for a hotel, then don't book here. Awful experience - Awful hotel - Awful Customer Service

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alyson100
Reviews.Content: After reading all the reviews on this hotel i have to say i was a little dubious... but after spending a week staying there i have to say this was a fantastic place to stay! the location is ideal, the staff are really friendly and more importantly the rooms are VERY clean!!! Overall I would say this is probably the best hotel we have ever stayed in the area of Kings X and I am extremely fussy! but if you want to be near all the tourist locations this is definately the place to come!

Reviews.Title: “A Cheap London Hotel - Clean and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: KX
Reviews.Content: London is the world's second most expensive city. Moderate hotel prices start at Â£120-150/night; cheap is around Â£50/night. This hotel is cheap, it has clean and compact rooms, it has few amenities - it is for sleeping not dining or swimming or dreaming you are in a Â£225/night Hilton. For its price class it is good, it is non-smoking, it is near King's Cross with Tube access everywhere. It has friendly staff and wonderful if treated with respect. It does not pretend to be what it is not, and $120 might seem a lot to some for a hotel room but it is peanuts in London where the Tube fare starts at $6 and a beer costs the same. This is an hotel to sleep in, nothing more.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible . Did Not Even Stay”
Reviews.Author: fudgeypants
Reviews.Content: Booked through late rooms for just one night ,wish i had gone with my instinct and cancelled. We picked our keys up accross the road at their sister hotel. So glad that we were not staying there as it was horrible. As i had booked over the net I was taken to a back room to put my pin number in for the card transaction.This felt very unsafe especially as it was a very scruffy office with a very unwelcoming member of staff. We were then shown over the road in the pouring rain to our "luxury suite" by a lady who could not realy give us much info as she did not speak much english. Our room was on top floor, very small double, missing lampshades and marks all around one side of the wall the made me wonder what had happened in the room previously. Tiny shower room which i could not figure out how you were going to turn arround in and actually wash! As the room was disgusting and the whole building was like a furnace we decided after a discussion to leave. We told them it was not up to standard and did not dare ask for money back. we ended up booking into a hotel near baker street tube called the four seasond which was lovely and had a great breakfast the next morning.

Reviews.Title: “what a robbery for a hole in a wall”
Reviews.Author: amontillado
Reviews.Content: I was booked for one of the 3 other hotels they have. They charched and then told me, I would be in the albionhouse. What a dive. Dirty, very small, noisy and not save at night. Staff unfriendly. All for 60 Pounds. Not a bargain... a robbery!! Never never again. Had hairs of other guests in bed and toilet.

Reviews.Title: “The worst ever without question”
Reviews.Author: 1redrose
Reviews.Content: The hallway and staircase are about 2 ft. wide and very steep. The room is microscopic, no place to put anything. Shower is 2 ft by 1-1/2 ft, if even that big. No clean towels and just one cheap, tiny soap for two adults for two days. Cheap styrofoam cups for, count 'em, 1 cup instant coffee, which was not replaced the second day. There was no phone in the room and no pay phone on premises. Breakfast in the cellar required a long wait in line for a space, and hostile kitchen help. And for this we paid over 75 pounds!

HotelInfo.Name: Albion House Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 29 Argyle Square | King's Cross, London WC1H8AL , England
